Reviews.Title: “Good service, but hotel is just adequate”
Reviews.Author: psprof
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference that was being held at a nearby hotel, which was more expensive and lacked free internet/breakfast. I chose HI Express for miles, location, and price. From the hotel, you cannot take a standard shuttle fair not he Toronto Express shuttle. This is a little annoying because they charge extra for a "connector" service. On the return, I just walked to Sheraton Center and took the shuttle from there for a little discount. Probably not a good option with a lot of luggage, though. The service of the hotel was quite good. I had a good check-in experience and they actually called a few minutes after I arrived in my room to make sure there were no problems. They put me on the top floor and although the window is small, there is actually a decent view of some of the city skyline. Breakfast was fine as for a business style hotel. They have a pancake machine, which is interesting. I did not try it, but it looked like fun. Standard yogurt, bread, mass produced eggs, and bacon/sausage available. My sleep was fine. I did not notice any noise problems and the bed was comfortable. There is a nice desk and couch as well for working from the room if necessary. The free internet works fine. I had a problem with the bath stopper, which didn't work when I had some back pain. I called down and they tried to fix it, but couldn't so they gave me a new room. They were very good about fixing the problem by providing a different room. After changing rooms, I fixed two other problems. My TV was also messed up (not providing good quality or all the stations), and the fan was making too much noise. My advice - if you have a problem with the room, be sure to tell them and get a new room. In general, the hotel could use with an update to the TV and some minor repairs in the rooms and other areas. Even the elevator buttons were falling off. Problems: - The location is not the best. I was actually surprised because I thought it was a good spot, but it seems a few blocks away from major shopping/dining areas. I actually felt a little uncomfortable at night because there were not a lot of people around and most of the neighborhood looked closed. A few places were open for eating, but it seemed a bit limited. For those new to Toronto, it might be good to walk around in the daylight to get your bearings before venturing out for a place to eat at night. This may be due to my own bias, coming from Japan, where I never feel uncomfortable and there are people everywhere in the cities. It could be perfectly safe, and my cultural bias makes it more uncomfortable for me. - No refrigerator in the room. This is something I dislike. - No safe in the room. I have seen how cleaning staff leave all the rooms wide open during their cleaning schedules in most hotels. I do not trust that someone can just walk in and take stuff. I like to have a safe in the room. I used the safe in the lobby, but they required a $50 deposit in case of a lost key ($100 lost key charge). It is also a small safe box, so you cannot store larger items like computer products. Overall, the hotel experience was adequate, but nothing I would get excited about for future visits. I would probably try to find someplace else to stay for a similar price if it were possible. Unfortunately, I am not sure that it is possible. So, for this price, maybe this is the best you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted!”
Reviews.Author: malhen
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an affordable, clean and well-run hotel near the centre of Toronto, with breakfast! We found one at the downtown Holiday Express Inn. We were amicably welcomed by the efficient reception staff. Our room was immaculate and well-presented. Ample storage, a spotless en suite, two whopping queen size beds (we had simply booked a "twin" room), a coffee machine and a TV offering many US and Canadian channels, but also BBC World Service (yippee!). The self-service breakfast was more than satisfying with cereals, cooked options, toast etc. etc. and of course pancakes along with other patisseries, fresh fruit and fresh coffee. Meant we could skip lunch! A three minute walk from the handy Streetcar and Subway (underground) networks. All-in-all excellent value and we would happily return and recommend. One request for the management. Could they leave some clear written instructions how to operate the coffee maker? As a technophobe I was struggling with it, simple though it probably was. Ended up with more coffee in the tray than in the cup.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently-located and budget-friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle N
Reviews.Content: While my husband was in Toronto on a 10-day business trip, I fly in to spend the weekend with him and explore the city. We were put up at the Holiday Inn Express on Lombard Street in downtown Toronto, and while I didn't have high expectations for the HIE, I was pleasantly surprised. The location is absolutely ideal. We were within easy walking distance of countless shops, restaurants, and bars, and thanks to the $20/day parking (a steal in a major city), we had easy access to our rental car to reach more out-of-the-way locations. The room is basic and clean. The bed is more comfortable than I anticipated, and the view was great from our 12th floor room. It would be nice if the windows had light-blocking curtains rather than double sheers, but that's simply being nitpicky. It certainly didn't ruin our trip! The free wi-fi is a great hotel perk, though it can be quite slow, noted particularly when trying to video chat with family back home. The bathroom is spacious and clean, the tub larger than a standard, the towels softer than many other hotels I've stayed in. The free breakfast is great, especially if you're looking to cut corners and save. There's absolutely no need to pay for breakfast elsewhere when the HIE serves eggs, breakfast meat, pancakes, muffins, bagels, toast, fruit, cereal, juices, teas, coffees, milk, and more. We had a hearty breakfast and didn't even need lunch - we just had an early dinner around 4:30 and were quite content. There's some hallway noise and street noise, but nothing that was enough to keep us awake or be terribly disturbing. Our stay was wonderful, and my husband was happy to have a cozy little place to call home during his business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great night in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: mboyle
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms at htis hotel. It was my daughter's 18th birthday so I took her and osme of her friends for a night in Toronto and the whole experience was great Check in -. We got there at 1:45 and all three rooms were ready. We requested rooms on the same floor, a high floor with a view of the city. All of our requests were accomodated I can honestly say that is the first time that has ever happened. I travel quite a bit and thtere is always some reason why rooms can't be together or whatever our request happens to be, but not so at this hotel Parking - 20.00, parking is underground right on site - a great deal in downtown Toronto. Rooms - nothing fancy, but they were clean and the beds were very comfortable. We had rooms ont he 14th floor and we could see Lake Ontario, the CN tower and lots of lights at night - very nice. Breakfast - for a free breakfast it was great, again probably one of the best I've had and included bacon, eggs, pancakes, baked goods, toast, bagels, a couple of fruit selections, cereal, juice etc. CHeck out - very smooth, no wait. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “First time”
Reviews.Author: smurfanda
Reviews.Content: Hotel front desk was professional and remembered my request for no feather pillows in the room. The room was clean and housekeeping was helpful. The beds are very comfortable! The breakfast buffet in the morning was just what we needed before heading out again. The hotel is right downtown! Great location! Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and location”
Reviews.Author: Draniac
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here on a hockey themed trip. The staff were very nice the place was clean and inexpensive for Toronto. The AC Heat unit had to be manually regulated. Internet connection was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “First Hockey Games”
Reviews.Author: grampyken
Reviews.Content: We went to our first Toronto Maple Leaf hockey game in Toronto on 23 Jan 12. We found Holiday Inn Express Toronto Downtown on line and book our room. The price was excellant, the staff were excellant and the location was excellant. My wife and I have stayed in many hotels across the country and the USA but so far for a hotel not being 5 star the service was outstanding and our small dog was welcomed with open arms. Any trips we require accomodations at in Toronto we will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: CBD0c
Reviews.Content: Room dusty and small, but acceptable. A little off the main part of downtown Toronto, but close enough to walk to most things. Breakfast good start to the day. Staff very polite, professional and friendly. BUT the main, single, computer in the lobby for guest use is SO SLOW. They need to upgrade this machine and speed of their internet. Checking my email and printing boarding passes took 30 minutes, waste of my time. For this reason alone I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: simeon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before on business but this time I went with my wife because of a concert we had tickets to in the city. It is in a great location a few blocks from the subway and about a block from the King Street Streetcar. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, although I find the rooms at this hotel a little dark. The wifi worked well. The breakfast is typical Holiday Inn Express fare and quite acceptable. I would not hestitate to book again at this hotel as the prices are quite reasonable for being right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet stay, lots of shopping!”
Reviews.Author: akide
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on December 30th. Check in was a breeze, check in staff Dylan processed me very efficiently and I didn't have any issues at all. The property is a bit dated, and the television was the old CRT variety. Not LCD/LED/Plasma variety. When I got to my room, everything was in order, this property is not a recently renovated Holiday Inn Express property, however the price which I booked at, and the location of this hotel was excellent. This hotel is located two blocks away from St. Lawrence market which opens very early in the morning on weekends, where one can purchase just about anything. Fresh fruit, meats, vegetables, cheese, breads etc. Also a few blocks north west is the large mall in Toronto, Eaton Centre. This mall spends a few stories, includes many notable stores such as Abercrombie and Fitch, Apple Store, Hollister, Lacoste, and many more. Many other electronics stores such as Best Buy and Future Shop is right near by too! This hotel includes complimentary wi-fi Internet, complimentary breakfast which had a number of different muffins, eggs, sausage, breads, cereals, pancakes, juice, milk, apples/oranges/bananas, and a variety of teas and coffees. Please do note that parking costs $20. In the morning a copy of the Globe and Mail newspaper was delivered outside of my room door. The furniture of my room and the lobby is a bit dated, however for the price I paid, and the location of the hotel, I didn't have too many issues with the dated furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: GyW
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance to Waterfront, Eaton Center, St. Lawrence Market. Breakfast was very good. Rooms need a revamping (compared with other HI Express where we have been).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel in November, 2011. Its a great location, clean bed room and very friendly staff. The breakfast was very good as well. My family really enjoyed the weekend and we will definitely stay there again. Thank you and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Old but well located”
Reviews.Author: Adil_Vaz
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here long ago, and liked the location. So we decided to give it a try. The hotel needs renovation, but the staff is very friendly and helpful and the free breakfast is surprisingly good. Very close to St. Lawrence market, and you can walk to the waterfront. CN Tower is not far away. All in all, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: klew97
Reviews.Content: I like to stay in the city center, and I know what to expect from the Holiday Inn chain. The location was just off a major road, so traffic noise was not a problem. The streets are wide, clean, and well-lit. The included breakfast is decent, enough to save you a bit of money, though the selection isn't lavish. I didn't notice any food items running out as time went on (sometimes the "good" stuff is gone before the last hour). Most of the city's attractions are in walking distance, and there are many restaurants and food options within a short walk, the Eaton Centre shopping area is less than 1km away (adjacent to Queen Station). I didn't I have a car, so I can't judge the value of using the parking lot. There is a lobby computer to check email, do touristy research, and print boarding passes. Free wi-fi worked well, and the room was larger than I expected, maybe being a Priority Club member had something to do with it. I was on the 14th floor, with a nice view of the harbor over St James Park, so I could open the windows (also unexpected) to see the Occupy Toronto campsite activities. The elevators did not chime when they arrive at your floor, so it is possible to never notice that one stopped to pick you up. I would rate this hotel around 3.5/5, but this rating system doesn't allow half grades. I would recommend this hotel to others who want above average quality for a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: walcottia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the start of a three week tour of Canada and the Sates. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly and, arriving in a quiet midweek just before Canadian Thanksgiving we were given a top floor room with a great view of the Lake. The furnishings need a makeover but this hotel represented great value for money. It is situated in the old town and in easy walking distance of the city and the tour bus if you want to use it. We have travelled widely and felt safe walking back here even late at night.The breakfast was included in the price and included a good range of hot and cold food and a range of drinks. The hotel has a mini-launderette, very useful if, like us you are travelling light.The cost of washing and drying a load came to $4CAN and helped us on our way. There is free internet access in the foyer. The staff made bookings for us as needed. Around the corner was the refurbished market where we bought a great seafood meal in atmospheric surroundings for about $9CAN a head.A great place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ywamer_10
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time downtown Toronto. The location is perfect. We walked to the Eaton Center and all over downtown. We also loved the proximity to many amazing restaurants. The rooms were nothing special and fairly small, not for families, but the breakfast and location made it a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping/sightseeing trip to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: live001
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our needs - comfortable, clean, complimentary breakfast, central location within walking distance to most attractions and shopping, friendly staff, and Internet service with ability to print boarding passes at the hotel. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel in need of a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Rich H
Reviews.Content: This is a standard holiday inn hotel, located in a good location, room although was non smoking, smelt of cigarettes, but only slightly. Room was a reasonable size and breakfast was not the best and very busy, only a few table to sit at and not great food. Was annoyed that even though I was a guest in the hotel was charge $20 parking per night. Main reception in need of a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drew J
Reviews.Content: Nothing was exceptional, but as a business hotel for a few nights it was a great place. Just a few blocks from everything it worked great for me. Room was clean and quiet, although a little hot so I kept the window open. I would stay again if the price remains low.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and right”
Reviews.Author: Viajante_09
Reviews.Content: We arrived late night and the location seemed to us a bit dark. But, the staff was extremely helpfull and warm. It`s a simple hotel that has only the necessary, but it`s clean and with a good location. The breakfast is self service way and there is a laundry room that you can use with some coins. The heating system is very noise and difficult to set ( or was very hot or very cold) and we prefered not turning on. The bed was supercomfy! I loved. I would recommend this hotel if you don`t want to spend much money and wants a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Partial view of the Tower”
Reviews.Author: MrTravel007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Holiday Inn's and this one isn;t my favourite. I mean it's nice to see part of the skyine and partial view of the CN tower and harbour. The area is not so nice, they are a lot of "strange" people around this area so be careful at night. Not that i mind a good protest as Occupy Toronto is right outside my window, it makes me feel a bit tribal as i constantly hear the beat of a single drum. As many hotels this one is no different to noise violations, you can hear people in the hall clearly and TV's in the rooms beside you. I always travel with a "white noise" maker for these exact reasons. The parking is not included and it's 20.00 a day. It is nice to hear St.James church bells i must admit, and if you have a "autrium" view you can see it nicely. The only problem is the windows make you feel in a fish tank, very,, very small. It's in big need of an update, and smells a bit funky and even "smokey". Guess that tells you how long ago it was updated. Anyway i may stay again, and may not it depends if i find something better. I found the hotel staff very helpful and it would not be there fault for an older hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good except for the Party”
Reviews.Author: Dillboy
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 7pm on Saturday night. One room on our floor was having a party liked with the stairwell. I informed the front desk on our way out about. He stated that "security would take care of it" At 1am the party was still going on. In the morning I took the stairwell down from my floor t the lobby, it only exited to the street, where I found beer cans in the stair well and the rock to keep the door open. Security did NOT do their JOB. The morning breakfeast was good with lots to choose from, but no cut fruit. GOOD JOB HERE!! For two days one of three elevators was broke which was a traffic jam in the AM. The elevators are also the ONLY way to get to the parking which is under the building. Never could find stairs to it. The beds here are hard but there were a plenty of pillows to use. This was a good location for us to get around the city on foot and car.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arnt78
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms of a decent size, location is just ok. Friendly staff, ok rates. Best HIE breakfast i've seen. Stayed september 2011

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: jan100
Reviews.Content: normally stay a little more centrally, on yonge, when we go to toronto - but pricing meant we had to look around. This hotel came with good reviews & was a good location - so not compromising too much on locale. Very clean, all the ammenities - good size room & bathroom. Breakfast excellent - amazing selection. Very pleasant staff. You're about 2 - 3 blocks back from yonge so not a long walk to all the main shopping areas & food etc. Would definately recommend & stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, for reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: KatherineinCanada519
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the holiday inn in August 2011 for a concert at the Amphitheater. We arrived at the hotel a bit late - the concert started at 7pm and we arrived at 7pm. We waited for about 20 minutes in line to check in as there were 2 employees at the desk, and one was on the phone. It would have been nice if the people who were present at the desk were served first. Then we were informed that the underground parking lot was full. It was suggested that we park down the street - an outdoor parking lot. This made us a bit later for our concert. Also the parking lot we were referred to was not so great for leaving valuables when you have a jeep with the top down - we were concerned about the day that we leave because we were checking out before we were actually leaving Toronto. Luckily they did have free luggage storage! The people at the desk were busy again when we were going to ask about the phone number for a taxi, so we left and hoped to just flag one down. The physical quality of the hotel was good - spacious rooms, clean. Free continental breakfast was good. The main selling feature for us was the relative inexpensive price ($150 for the night) and the reviews about the physical quality of the building, which was decent. I am indifferent to staying here again, I would take something else if it were the same price for the same conveniences of price, location, and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rosario_it
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the late evening after a long walk from the bus station. The receptionist was quite kindly and gave us a map and explained us the main attraction of Toronto. As Platinum in the Priority Club he said that the water would have been free even though there was a price on the bottle. Anyway, of the 4 nights only for the first two we found the bottle of water. But better than nothing, especially arriving in the late evening without water! The hotel is quite big and so with a lot of guests. We have really appreciated the breakfast, it was quite complete and with enough hot dishes. As in the other hotels in Canada we took advantage of the PC connected to internet but there was just ine PC and so the PC was ofter busy. The hotel is well maintened and staffed and the price is quite competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel not too far away from City Center”
Reviews.Author: CodyDC
Reviews.Content: Hotel was what I expected from the previous review on TripAdvisor which I read before booking this hotel. Hotel was easy to find driving from Niagara Falls and parking at the hotel was $20 per night. I had a top level room with views to the City Center towards the Lake. Hotel was easy walking distance to Eaton Centre, Hockey Hall of Fame, Union Station and waterfront and Civic Centre. King or Queen Subway stations not too far away but mostly just walked around the city. There was a wait upon check-in as the hotel staff were doing there best to accommodate different hotel guests, but after that everything was fine. Hotel has free Wifi which worked fine with both iphone and ipad. The breakfast was ok. There is also Starbucks right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and service”
Reviews.Author: DavidEstrada
Reviews.Content: The hotel its very nice. they make their best effort to make you happy. you can leave your suitcases after checkout, leave deposit in cash at time of check in. the location its GREAT, you dont need to have a car or use metro to go and return from the hotel. parking its expensive (20 dollars) but its the overall price for the parking in toronto. breakfast its perfect to start the day and serves from 630am. i stayed two times. the second time the ac failed and they changed my room very fast. the only thing i didnt like was that the hotel uses carpets in the rooms and i could see the stains. why hotels dont take all of that old carpets that only keep taking dust and put a nice floor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Terrific Staff and a very good breakfast included!”
Reviews.Author: Aceone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to all Toronto attractions. From the minute I stepped into the hotel every staff member I encountered was friendly and appeared to be very motivated to making every guest feel welcome, including calling me shortly after checkin to be sure everything was fine with my room. The room was a decent size and the bonus was that it had windows that opened. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but brreakfast was included in the price of my room. Breakfast included eggs, bacon, sausage, lots of fruit, bagels, pastries, etc. and very good coffee. Normally I stay at the Sheraton or Delta Chelsea (where breakfast can be $40 for about the same fare as was included in this room). There are many restaurants in the area so I likely would not have had dinner in the hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but brilliant”
Reviews.Author: hilseymour
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights while staying in Toronto on holiday. I had a great stay and no problems with my room or anything else during my visit. The reception staff were really really good and I feel they deserve a special mention for being so helpful. On arrival they were very thorough and welcoming, and they were also on hand at any time to answer my queries, change money for me and went out of their way to help me book a trip to Niagara Falls after my arranged tour was cancelled at the last minute. Breakfast was served in a few rooms downstairs from a buffet - I arrived early each day and it was always pretty busy. The food was basic but very adequate and there was a good range of choice including cereals, breads, pancakes, fruit, yoghurts and cooked food as well. My room was nice too with a very comfortable bed, useful desk and couch and clean, compact bathroom. The TV had a selection of channels and pay-per-view options available. The room had free wifi access which was very useful to me, but if you don't have a laptop there is a computer in reception you can use. When I checked out the reception guy said I owed $3.99 for the bottle of water in my room, which I hadn't opened and which was still in the bathroom. I told him I hadn't used the water and he just said, "okay then, no problem" and that was that! I thought this was a bit strange, and wondered what was going on there, but nothing major. The location of the hotel was great for everywhere I wanted to go and was within walking distance of Front Street for the CN Tower and Hippo Tour, and also walking distance from the Coach Station on Bay Street, and various subway stations, including the main station where you can get the GO train etc. It's also next to a very beautiful old church (St James) with a garden area for sitting.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect basecamp”
Reviews.Author: RaphaelBE
Reviews.Content: After staying at a whole bunch of hotels in Toronto (all of them perfectly fine), I believe I've now found my 'default' hotel in the Holiday Inn Express. The location is hard to beat: you're less than a 10 minute walk away from Queen Street or Dundas Square and less than a 5 minute walk away from public transport. Still, no noise from the street to keep you awake. Even better might be the fact that there's a very nice park next door and you're within walking distance of both Kensington Market and a 24 hour supermarket. Rooms are maybe getting a bit old (just small things that you'll start to notice after a while, no deal breakers though) and the breakfast was only average. Sure, it's quite extensive and filling but there's probably not enough variety to keep you interested for more than a few days. Still, it's included in the price so you shouldn't fell guilty if you were to skip breakfast at the hotel one day and go somewhere else. As well as breakfast, internet access if included free of charge and works well. Finally, I should mention how friendly the staff was. Just excellent and helpful all around!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: A B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 7 nights at the Holiday Inn express ( Downtown Toronto) For my sisters wedding that was taking place that week. I have been to many hotels. It was busy week but their staff was great helping in directions and the use of free wifi & computers downstaires! The hotel was close to all shopping and restuarants! There is a beautiful walking park in front of the hote, the staff there is amazing and know what they are doing. The complemetary breakfast is great too-- Its was 100% or you could to Toronto Fairmont Hotel ($32.00) a plate for breakfast, crazy expensive not as good service and the same food!! I would recommend this great hotel to anyone who is travelling to Toronto!! Thanks for a great stay I will stay again When I travel back to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and staff”
Reviews.Author: JordiC4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, just at the beggining and at the end of a tour around SW Canada. It's really a good place to explore downtown Toronto at your own way, since you can get to anywhere walking. The room was clean and cosy, and we sleeped really well. Moreover, the staff tryed to ensure our confort and were very helpful in giving us advice about where to go to dinner, for instance. I would recommend it to friends visiting Toronto. The only drawback I'd like to mention is the tiny breakfast room. Sometimes it was difficult to find a free table, and we were asked to share our table by another couple on one occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous customer service”
Reviews.Author: dsgranny
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Great breakfast. Eager to assist. Rooms clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location was good, but there must be better hotels out there....”
Reviews.Author: pippaz2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights to attend the Toronto Film Festival for work. My choice of hotel was mostly about the location, and this location was perfect for my two days in town. After arriving at 10pm I was told, there is no food service. This happens, so I thought I'd get settled into my room and then look at options. After getting the elevator up to my room, there was no mini-bar or even a free bottle of water (this seems to be standard in hotels when you are playing close to $200/night). So, I called the front desk to see if I could order a pizza to be delivered. I called the front desk 4 times in 60 minutes and no one answered. It was before midnight and also one of the busiest weekends in Toronto, so I was surprised there was no one manning the desk, even tho it was late. The TV was from the 80's, huge and didn't have great reception. Also, the elevators were broken, so I had to walk 16 flights down to the lobby with no real apology or explanation from the front desk. Overall, the location if you are mainly visiting downtown Toronto is great. I walked everywhere, which was 10-15 minutes away. But, if you want some of the standard, hotel service, I'd go elsewhere. But if price and location are key and you aren't spending a lot of time at the hotel, it's probably a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Ved M
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express in Toronto is in a great location for sights, restaurants, shopping or business. The rooms are basic, yet clean and comfortable, good value for the rates. Must extend kudos to the staff I interacted with during my trip, Chris, Rajiv, Suku and Ron were very courteous and helpful and they contributed to a great vacation experience. Will definitely stay at this Holiday Inn Express on my next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: buciIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to downtown. Staff efficient, helpful and friendly. Rooms are quite good and comfortable. We stayed there for 11 days and had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: giraffepainter
Reviews.Content: The service was good; the air conditioner in the room was very loud, there was no little fridge. However the breakfast was good and the location is excellent especially for Buskerfest .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Close to Downtown Core”
Reviews.Author: voyager075
Reviews.Content: From now on when business takes me to right downtown Toronto, I will stay here. It's about a 10 minute walk west to the Eaton Centre and Yonge Street. A 10-minutes walk south lands you amidst the restaurants & bistros of Front Street and The Esplanade. The rate compared to hotels right in the core is well worth the walk. The location at Jarvis & Lombard streets is a gradually gentrifying scene. In other words, the area has some modern stores alongside some rundown facades. The hotel is clean and functional. My room comfortable and well-appointed. Would be nice to have a workout room but they apparently offer access to a gym in the area. Hot breakfast offered choice and was tasty. Staff friendly. Bottom lineâ€“it's a very good deal for being so close to the core.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Addy33
Reviews.Content: Our stay and the Holiday Inn Express was terrific. The front desk clerk "Chris" was very personable and helpful. In fact, any of the front desk clerks we talked to were very polite and considerate. The motel itself was very clean and well-kept. Our room was a nice size and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was great. Always fresh and well-stocked. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Toronto and certainly would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our go-to hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: suzmom
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy here, but the service is fabulous (the clerk searched until he found us 2 perfect rooms that were adjoining and later stopped us to make sure they were to our liking), the free breakfast is fast and simple, but way more than a sweet roll and cereal, and it is close to everything. We walked to The Keg on the Esplanade for dinner, to Eaton Centre to shop, and it was a short drive to the Portlands for Cirque du Soliel. This is our second stay here and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Tired and Not So Central”
Reviews.Author: Kr3m3Puff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is late 80's era from my guess and the rooms were sort of what you would expect. While in adequate condition, they could be updated. The breakfast area was a warren of rooms attached together and felt very crowded and hard to navigate. Also, while the hotel is "downtown" it is probably in the least friendly part of downtown and anything is a decent walk away. I didn't impress and it borderline disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job for us”
Reviews.Author: mimsydee
Reviews.Content: Good value for downtown Toronto. Room was clean, perhaps a bit shopworn, but so are my furnishings at home, just to not be a hypocrite in this review. The location is on the edge of a less spiffy Toronto area, but we had no problems with anyone out and about in the neighborhood. We really liked the breakfast, which had a lot of variety in a small space. The pancake machine is way cool, make sure you try it out. Odd - a letter posted in elevator said that management was negotiating a new labor agreement with the union representing its employees. It said that the workers have authorized a work stoppage if negotiations fail to lead to a contract. You could contact the hotel manager with any questions, according to the letter. We had no problems or issues of any kind with the employees, so service seemed quite normal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ala898
Reviews.Content: Room was great, big, clean, and non smoking :) staff were very friendly and helpful.. hotel is within walking distance to great attractions in downtown Toronto.. like Dundas square.. a must see if you 're there... plus many shopping areas and restaurants..

Reviews.Title: “We had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: oscart77
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the day, so we used the hotel primarily as a place to sleep. The location was very convenient to the King, Queen and Yonge streets area and appeared safe and well lit. My wife and I walked back from dinner on King Street around 9:30 and felt very safe . We never encountered suspicious characters mentioned in other posts and found people in general to be friendly and helpful. I think folks generally see what they want to in others. Our room was about average size with a comfortable queen bed and good view of the city. We had an upper floor room as requested and away from the elevator, so a quiet night was enjoyed. This was not a newly renovated hotel but we found it to be clean and well maintained. All staff members that we encountered were pleasant, friendly and helpful. The front desk area was always pretty busy but gave their full attention and were very competent. Parking in the garage was non eventful and our car was easily accessed when needed. We were allowed to leave our car several hours beyond checkout the next day. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms - close to downtown activities”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelling2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good lobby. The hotel is about 5 blocks from Yonge Street, which was an easy walk. The front desk staff and room attendants are friendly. The parking is more than adequate; it has only a 6 feet 1 inch clearance. However, the quality of our stay was not good for the following reasons: 1. The room had a queen bed and a single bed in the hide a bed. Both were crammed into the room. The room felt very cramped; 2. The television was a very old model; 3. The window to the outside was so small the room felt like a cell; 4. A neighbour across the court yard had a very large telescope pointed right at the windows of the hotel. This was very creepy; 5. The air conditioning unit seemed old; 6. The lights in the room and the bathroom were dim. (The bathroom only had one light; not the extra heat lamp light.) This is okay in the hallways, but not in the room itself. We are frequent Holiday Inn users. The $400 for 2 nights was not good value. We will not visit this site again, nor would we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good but understaffed front desk”
Reviews.Author: shinyleaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel's computer system was down for quite a few hours when we arrived, which slowed down check-in considerably. Front desk seemed under-staffed on each shift. The hotel staff were checking people in manually and ended up giving the same room keys to two other parties who walked into our room. Fortunately we were there and weren't terribly bothered by this. Staff apologized and were clearly stressed. Management made no attempts to compensate us for these inconveniences, and seemed to grumble when the front desk attendant approached him for the OK to reimburse a day of unused parking I had previously paid for. Rebate was granted. Very good breakfast and great downtown location. Just a bad day for the hotel, which should have been handled better by the management.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCookey
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times. The rooms are very nice, the location is excellent and the breakfast is also very good. There is an underground garage for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty...thought I had a bad room until I saw the other rooms”
Reviews.Author: gregstrick9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for its proximity to my father's apartment in June 2011 while in Toronto for his wedding. Service was slow and during our entire stay there always seemed to be a line of people to the door either waiting to check in or check out. We got to our room and immediately went to the front desk to as for another room. I hate being adjacent to the elevators, but then I realized that almost EVERY room was either opening to the elevator lobby or along the side or backside of the elevators. It wasn't too noisy, so I stuck with the room behind the elevator. Inside, it was quaint, but the sofa was absolutely disgusting...to the point where I had to ask for additional towels to lay over it before I would get near it. The rest of the room was better...the bed was a little too soft for my liking, but at least it wasn't as filthy as the couch. The positives - it had a working toilet, hot water, and a good free breakfast! If I have to I'll stay here again because it's so close to my father, but avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarahcue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for a city break, on arrival we were given an early check in, reception staff were really friendly, the room was a good size, plenty of towels and complimentary toiletries! We had a problem getting the air conditioning on, but reception solved the problem then called back 10mins later to check everything was ok...breakfast was good, plenty to eat, was well stocked, on the whole a great hotel near to amenities and sights, no complaints from us :-)

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned and fairly cheap.”
Reviews.Author: OldhamSheridan
Reviews.Content: A hotel positioned well for downtown Toronto. A fairly large room, two double beds and fully air conditioned. Well positioned for any of your city centre needs, just 15 minutes walk from downtown and ten from Queen Street station. Helped us get alcohol, as being foreigners we didn't realise they were exclusively sold in liquor stores. I doubt you can get more cost effective in the downtown area and we had no problems whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel! Good location. Very friendly staff, but the breakfast area is too small e busy, considering the size of hotel. N”
Reviews.Author: engenheirow
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Very good deal for the price. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: pinoy99
Reviews.Content: good location - close to hhof, lawrence market, eaton center, etc free breakfast with good selection friendly staff free wifi parking with direct access to hotel elevator small room,bathroom but clean no lcd/plasma tv would be excellent value if parking is free ($20/night with in/out priv)

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in town”
Reviews.Author: Kodabear7
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding in town the staff was amazing and super friendly! The breakfast was great since it was free. We went to fairmont hotel for breakfast one morning and it was 28.00$ for breakfast for one person! At the holiday inn you got the same food and just as good quality!!! I would def stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jc2626
Reviews.Content: Our needs for accommodation in Toronto were simply a room for 2 nights to sleep, as we were flying in late the first night, and spending the whole next day in Niagara Falls, before flying out again the next day. When researching for hotels, I couldn't believe how expensive this city was! So for our needs, this hotel was ideal. It is convenient, clean and comfortable for the price. The staff were very nice, and I think the breakfast was great! A lot of hotels we stayed at did not offer a free breakfast, so I think the hotel offers a delicious and plentiful selection.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, on walking distance from city centre and subway”
Reviews.Author: MikeN76
Reviews.Content: My standard room in de Holiday Inn Express was very nice, spatious and comfortable (a large bed, a large seat, desk, chair, and of course tv); the bathroom was sufficient as well. Rooms are very clean, as is the hotel. Breakfast buffet is rather limited in choice and at some times a bit crowded, but still okay to start your day. Although the hotel is not in the city centre, you can reach the centre with a 10-15 minute walk. The hotel is on a 8 minute walk from the nearast subway station ("Queen" station, yellow line), which is convenient to reach other locations in the city. The neighbourhood of the hotel is relatively quiet, with a nice park very nearby. All in all I had a very good experience here, and I would recomment the hotel to other travellers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and quality-price”
Reviews.Author: depo77
Reviews.Content: I was very comfortable at the hotel, it is very near everywhere, area is quite good Service is good, room is big with a nice big comfortable bed..bathroom is ok, not best I ever saw but practical! The breakfast isnt great but good enough to have something to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Best complimentary breakfast ever!”
Reviews.Author: Spongebob083
Reviews.Content: My family and I chose this hotel because of their advertised complimentary breakfast and we were impressed! The choices were vast, the food all fresh and the Filipina ladies replenishing the buffet selections offered the best service. My husband absolutely loved the cinnamon rolls and my 8-year old boy had fun preparing his different breakfast concoctiond and he finished them, too. i just loved the eggs and bacon and sausages... On top of that, Chris at the reception was most helpful with how to get around and booked us a nice limo to the airport. The cleaning lady was also very efficient. This hotel is conveniently located and our room had a very scenic view. We would definitely stay here again and tell our friends of our pleasant experience. Thank you very much for a wonderful stay (5 nights!). We are back home now and still misses the breakfast when we wake up in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what one would hope for..”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this property, and all in all was satisfied. On occasion I had some small niggles (only decaf coffee left for the coffee maker, trash bag not replaced in bin) but there weren't the kind to make me storm off and complain. An in-room laptop safe would have been a nice touch. Staff were friendly, the room was comfortable and reasonably large. Wifi was free and fast, and while the breakfast won't win any gourmet awards, it was a perfectly acceptable spread. The location also made it ideal of exploring downtown, with excellent transit connections to other parts of the city. There's plenty of places to eat nearby, combined with Starbucks/Tim Hortons etc for coffee and a 24/7 grocery/supermarket just blocks away. I'd certainly have no hesitation in staying here again, given the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, brilliant value.”
Reviews.Author: Sturmey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The staff were extremely courteous,and helpful. We e-mailed the hotel before our stay and they replied very promptly and, more importantly, acted on our request. The hotel was clean and the room spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was standard but was more than adequate for us. The location is very good with access to the majority of the tourist sites no more than 25 minute walk away. Perhaps the best comment I can make is that we would undoubtedly stay at this hotel if we were to visit Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but perfectly adequate.”
Reviews.Author: kate_nl
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights there. It is right downtown and within walking distance to the eaton centre, the subway and many other places of interest. The free breakfast is a nice bonus and has more selection than I expected. The room was basic but met our needs. It was very clean and the beds are very comfortable and quiet. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Helgi60
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine. Everything. The hotel was clean, had excellent staff & service, the bed was good, the location also. Breakfast was excellent. Nothing to complain about! If I had to name something, I'd probably say that I wish I could have opened a window (the room got a bit stuffy sometimes, but not really to the extent that it bothered me), and I'd also name the fact that sometimes I could hear the people next door. But that didn't really bother me either. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: pauliefromthenorth
Reviews.Content: Front desk personnel were always wonderful and professional. Room was clean and comfortable. The pillow top on the bed was nice. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. $8.00 dollars cab ride to downtown. Close to historic and tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: ebbie1081
Reviews.Content: My initial reaction of this hotel wasn't great. The parking was full and we were put in a smoking room despite booking a non-smoking one. We were quickly switched by the very helpful Chris at the front desk, who later called to follow up on our experience. The hotel is very clean and the room we had was very spacious. The hotel is a little old, but kept up nicely. It's about two blocks from the subway and within walking distance to the Eaton Centre and Dundas Square. The free breakfast in the morning was a real plus and very hearty!

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, great staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Bendy_Man
Reviews.Content: The location is very good and in walking distance of all the downtown sights. Rooms are standard, but very spacious and clean. The staff are very helpful and the breakfast buffet included in the room rate sets you up well for the day. All in all excellent value for downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gav1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night here, and the room was nice and large. The beds were comfortable and we ahd a quiet nights stay. The location was good, and the car park felt secure. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody at the hotel was AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: steveandcathy_11
Reviews.Content: I want to say thank you to Chris and Ron ,who work at the front desk, for warming up my chinese food in the wee hours of the morning; and thank you to Daniel, too bad I never had a chance to have a glass of wine with him lol Thanks for getting our suitcases from the storage room for the limo driver haha. also thank you to Veronica, our housekeeper and also Peppa on Veronica's day off; I can't remember the other guy's name at the front desk, i believer his name was Gabriel. Thanks so much for the hospitality and excellent customer service, we had a great time in Toronto. Cathy Barclay and Kimberly Thorne, Fredericton, NB

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Clean Hotel for the money with wonderful courteous service”
Reviews.Author: littlemama54
Reviews.Content: We were totally impressed with the Front Desk "Daniel" who welcomed us to the hotel and made all the arrangements for our stay both comfortable and pleasurable. This is a wonderful hotel with a full hot and cold breakfast included and neat, clean and comfortable rooms. Parking is right at the door (for a nominal fee) or only a quick walk to the TTC Streetcar and Subway. We will most definitely stay at this hotel again when going into Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: C182
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good downtown location, reasonably priced, and with easy walking access to the area and public transportation. There are good restaurants nearby and the popular/historic St. Lawrence Market. The front desk staff was particularly friendly and accommodating. The breakfast provided with the room is adequate, but nothing to write home about. It will give you the energy to last until you can get a good lunch at one of the many restaurants in the area. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. The hotel provided me with an above ground parking spot because my vehicle was too tall to go in the underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: teresab79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our baby for 3 nights and can't fault it - clean, comfy bed and excellent shower. Yes, it looks a little tired in places but for a freindly basic hotel with a complimentary breakfast it's brilliant. Well located for all that Toronto has to offer

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Governor13
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly service at the check in counter Pet friendly, pets stay free of charge. Comfortable bed and pillows. Plenty of towels. Free breakfast and internet. Cons: Walls and doors are thin, you can hear the people from across the hall drop their beer bottles and talking loud at 3 am. You can hear the people on the floor above us flushing their toilet. In room carpetingâ€¦crusty. Conclusion: Not too bad for 1 night and if you are travelling with a pet. You get what you pay for (109$ + 20$ Parking) Iâ€™m use to staying in suites in Toronto for around 140$.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected...”
Reviews.Author: chrisykris
Reviews.Content: When we arrived here, the receptionist gave us a ton of explanations and suggestions about visiting Toronto... The employees here were very friendly and helpful in every way! The location was really suiting, the Queen's subway station is about 2 blocks away, which is not too far when you're arriving from the airport by subway. We walked from the hotel to the CN Tower and Kensingtom Market, so we could explore the real Toronto, rich in cultures! The Saint Lawrence market is just a 5min walk away and is worth a visit! The breakfast was just perfect! Pancakes, eggs and bacon, cornbread, toasts and bagels, cinnamon rolls and good coffee! At such rates, I honestly think you can't find much better!!

Reviews.Title: “not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: footballtravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I staed here for 5 nights during October. On arriving at the hotel there was a problem with our booking, we had been placed in a smoking room when we had requested non smoking. The staff on the desk were not the most helpful as we had booked through a third party company and basically said it was tough. It was quite upsetting and embarassing and we both felt that it could have been handled more sensitively. The room they put us in smelt really badly of stale smoke, as did the whole floor and wasnt pleasant. It wasnt until my wife got really upset and started crying in reception that they made an effort to move us. The rooms are not the prettiest, the decor definately needed updating and the room they changed us too smelt a bit musty. The location is ok, not the best in my opinion but not the worst. There is, however, a homeless hostel nearby and people from there milling about. As we were travelling all over the states and canada keeping in touch with family was important and there was a computer that we could use in the lobby but was always broke and when it did work it did not connect to the internet very well. It is also not in the most private of place, so it made checking personal stuff like email very difficult. We liked what toronto had to offer but we would not return to this hotel after the experience with the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for this location”
Reviews.Author: voegelin
Reviews.Content: It's not the Ritz. It's not even a newly renovated state of the art HI. But, the service at check in was great, the room acceptable if a tad small and a tad dated. But the location! And the price! If you're a non-picky traveller like me, and just want service, cleanliness, good features and to be close to everything, this is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but a Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weerobbie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good being close to Yonge Street and King St and not far from the train station. The check-in service was very average. The small room was worn but clean. The bathroom was clean but nothing "flash." The bed was comfortable. IRoom price comes with the normal Hotel Inn Express breakfast. This is a budget hotel and good value but don't expect to be "wowed" by it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service that goes beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: portsmuf
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel regarding the rooms, its cleanliness, the comfortable beds and the quality of the hot and cold breakfast in the mornings, but what really needs to be said is how super the staff are. It didnt matter if you were requiring help from the front desk or the lady looking after breakfast, everyone seemed to go out of their way for you and nothing was too much trouble, all of it with a friendly smile. My friend and I were so impressed in fact that we are contacting the Holiday Inn Express to let them know too how great their team of staff are at this hotel. Oh, and the cherry on top is the location, we were a stone's throw from most of what we wanted to see and do in Toronto. To sum up, excellent quality hotel at a reasonable price and 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location; excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Cloudynine
Reviews.Content: Those two descriptions are the best part of the hotel. My husband and I stayed there one night this past week when we went to see a Maple Leafs Game. We were delighted with how easy it was to find the place and have the vehicle parked right there, for only $20/day. What a deal in Toronto! The front desk staff were absolutely top-notch. Daniel, I think his name was, even helped us with a map and gave us directions. Yes, the hotel is not updated and the rooms are small. The housekeeping could be better but for the price we paid, we were able to overlook a few things. We enjoyed having the complimentary breakfast. Free phone calls from the room was a nice feature as we called different restaurants, etc. We would definitely stay there again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayfus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, during the last week of Jan 2011. This hotel is in a great location, close to Queen St/Yonge St subway station and Eaton Center Mall. Other positive things: it offers FREE wifi, a FREE breakfast (eggs, sausage, pancakes, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, the works), it is very CLEAN, and offers a GREAT VIEW of downtown from a high floor window (we stayed on the 15th floor). Now for the downsides: there is nothing "luxurious" about this hotel (but as I said it's clean), the A/C and heating systems don't have a thermostat (you have to turn it on and off manually...which stinks when you're hot/cold in the middle of the night), no fridge in the room (not a deal breaker, but something I've come to expect). Back to the location: There are lots of great bars/restaurants on Front street (2-3 blocks away, walk down Jarvis St to get there). There is an "interesting" bar on the first floor called "Laide". It's definately worth going to with your spouse/partner because of its "uniquely adult" theme, but I wouldn't take any business associates there. As I mentioned, the nearest subway station is Queen/Yonge (about 3-4 blocks away), which will get you to the airport or to various sightseeing spots for $2.50 each way. Eaton center is also at Queen/Yonge which is a great shopping mall and connects to the PATH, a 20+ mile underground tunnel system you can take to get to places like CN tower (very nice when it's cold out). We didn't have any problems with the hotel staff. They didn't seem to know the area that well, but they were friendly and tried to help us when they could. All in all, I think the positives outweigh the negatives of this hotel. As long as the price is ~$30-$40/night less than higher quality properties (Hilton, Starwood, etc), then I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Petallitraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel was centrally located close to the historic area of Toronto. The room was clean and had two double beds, TV, fridge, microwave, free internet connection and free breakfast. The room was comfortable and quiet. We had a corner room which overlooked an old fire station and he view was delightful. Breakfast was a serve yourself buffet of cereal, pastries, crispy bacon, scones (biscuits), fruit and yogurt. The staff were helpful and friendly. Hotel was close to main attractions and walking distance to the CN Tower. We used the hop on hop off tour bus and would recommend this to visitors to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great......”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Galloway
Reviews.Content: Reasonable location, but very tired interior decoration (as many shades of brown as you could want!). The complementary breakfast is very basic; processed food, paper plates and plastic cutlery - decent coffe though. Noisy rooms with late revellers and thin walls. There are better hotels nearby for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to downtown BUT.......”
Reviews.Author: Snowman656
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Toronto with my brother for a few days. Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on Lombard. This Hotel has a good location to downtown Toronto, but I would pay extra attention to some of the people who hang around the hotel especially after dark. One evening I went across the street to beautifull St. James Park to take a few pictures. Within minutes a drunken homeless man came up to us accusing us of taking pictures of him and his friends " drinking beer and passing joints around" (To be honest I didnt realize they were there untill he confronted us.) Me and my brother also witnesed between 7-10 drug deals happen right outside of our window. Another instance I was out on my cellphone inright outside the front door and had a homeless man ask me 5 TIMES in less than 20 mins if I had any change. Besides the guy in St James park, I honestly did not feel threatened by these people, but I still kept my eyes open. The staff were absolutely amazing, and so was the breakfast. The rooms were a little small but I had no complaints at all. The front desk worked their butt's off to get us checked in early which is always appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and affordable for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Nighty2204
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews online I decided to book into this Hotel and I was glad that I did! Booking online from Australia always presents some risks, but from the moment we fell in the door at 10.30 pm from a 27 hour flight, to when we checked out 4 days later, we had nothing but positive experiences. The rooms are small yes, but you get what you pay for and our two children slept relatively comfortably in the shared double bed. The rooms were cleaned every day, the complimentary buffet was very satisfying and the Front desk personal were always ready to help us. It is also an easy walk to the Eaton Centre and down to the waterfront or Hockey Hall of Fame or CN Tower. I would recommend this hotel to families with chn or just people wanting a decent hotel at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: taismollica
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean and organized. The staff was helpful and nice. The parking is $20 a day, but every hotel in Toronto downtown charges separated for parking and $20 was a good price. The breakfast wasn't the best, horrible omelet, but they have yogurt, juice, coffee, bagels, cinnamon rolls, good scrambled eggs, apples and bananas and toast. free internet was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!! Clean, location couldnt be better. Free breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: megs1813
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, location was a ten minute walk to eaton center and theaters! Plenty of nearby restaurants and stores a short walk away. The room was so nice!! It was clean, comfortable, free wifi, computer in the lobby you could use with a printer free of charge also. The free continental breakfast had amazing selection, I was surprised at how much there was to choose from and the quality of the food. The people at the front desk were more than happy to give us directions and recommend places to eat. Only cons, were it is downtown so it could be noisy. Part of the hotel faces the main street and the other part of the hotel faces the side streets which is quieter. We stayed on the quieter side, I hardly heard anything. Parking was 20 dollars a day, which is less than most of the nearby hotels. Overall would totally recommend this place!! price was amazing, the location a bonus, also the free breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CentralABFamily
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The best feature, by far, is the location. It is very handy to the attractions we were most interested in seeing like the St. Lawrence Market, Hockey Hall of Fame and CN Tower. We found the rooms and beds to be very small, but tolerable because we spent most of the day out and about. Everything was clean and the service was excellent. The beds, linens and pillows were very comfortable. The free wireless internet worked very well. Breakfast was fine and had plenty of options. Our room faced Jarvis Street and was therefore quite loud, but I understand that noise should be expected in a large city.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: geoboy89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the very end of October. The location in the heart of the city is exactly what we were looking for. The room was clean, modern and quiet. The only thing thing that we did not like was the lack of a bar fridge in the room. Breakfast is included in the stay. Selections were simple but adequate and made for a nice start to the day. The lobby has a computer and printer that are free for anyone to use. Since we do not travel with a laptop, this service allowed us to easily check emails, weather updates, etc. Overall, a very positive experience. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: 2010CUBA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last month for two nights. I had no issuses what so ever. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. No the room was not the most modern but you get what you pay for!!!! The continental breakfast was very good and well stocked. I would for sure stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: allgoodinhwood
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with the value received by staying at this hotel. I got a clean, warm, comfortable room ... with free Internet, free continental breakfast, and a nice view of St. James Church and its adjoining park. I was within easy walking distance of King Street, Yonge Street, and the St. Lawrence Marketplace. One of the big plusses of the Holiday Inn Express chain for me is the sheeting-style bedding that they use. Compared to other lower-tier chains, I'm always confident the bedding at Holiday Inn Express will be clean and fresh. Staff was very friendly and helpful at both check-in and check-out. Sure, the tv's aren't of the more modern flat-screen variety, but they work and do what they're supposed to. I enjoy a good 4-star or 5-star hotel, but knew going in that this wasn't going to be that type of experience. For a 3-star experience, it was absolutely perfect. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: anamay44
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and would certainly stay there again. Staff was great. Hotel was spotlessly clean. Room was spacious. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Bedding and towels were of good quality and looked new. Very large bath towels. The breakfast was super...eggs, sausage, warm buns, toast, bagels, cereal, yogurt, warn cinnamon buns, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, juices, and milk.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Tired Holiday Inn...”
Reviews.Author: BMW70
Reviews.Content: ...in need of a good facelift. Holiday Inns have been having upgrades worldwide, but I think this one only received the new signs. I was not impressed and would choose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but over priced”
Reviews.Author: Orenb10
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Canada and stayed 4 nights in this hotel. Location is GREAT; i walked to all attractions and its 5-10 mins walk to downtown, 20 mins walk to CN tower. Breakfast was good, Muffins were NOT so fresh but the Cinnamon warm pastry was very good, cold â€œboiledâ€� eggs, selection of yogurts and bread, scramble eggs. Free Internet didnâ€™t work all time from the room (they had to change my room where it worked better), some connection loseâ€¦ The room was big with desk, TV with some channels and clean. Free coffee and tea from in the room. I might choose other hotel next time as it was too expensive to its value althou itâ€™s a good hotel but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “tired and outdated”
Reviews.Author: bruce14
Reviews.Content: First impression was the overwhelming smell of cigarette smoke, doesn't normally bother us as we are both former smokers, but this was truly overwhelming. Asked for a room change - but even though it was only 2pm, this was the last room left in the hotel and possibly the entire city. "Be thankful you are not on the 2nd floor" was our only consolation. Rooms are tired and outdated, ventilation very poor, windows open for the whole stay couldn't shift the smell, location a bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnowWhiteOnWhiteWine
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and were greeted with a warm reception. The man checking us in told us all about the hotel facilities. The room was spotless and a very good size. We had a pleasant view towards the Toronto waterfront over St James park and the St Lawrence market. The hotel is in a convenient area with restaurants not too far away (walking distance) The subways are also located a few blocks away from the hotel. Breakfast was fine and it was convenient to have it onsite. We stayed at this hotel a few years ago when it was not a Holiday Inn and would certainly stay there again. Free internet in the room was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: JKellyExeter_NH
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel for a three night getaway. It's not the Ritz, but you're not paying for the Ritz. Very clean well kept rooms. A superior breakfast. We arrived late our first night so the parking garage was full, but we were directed to an outdoor lot 50 yards down the road for just the first night. The staff was most pleasant and helpful. We could walk everywhere and the metro (we didn't use it) was not far at all. We slept very comfortably every night. A very quiet hotel. We were on the eighth floor. The free wireless internet in our room was a definite plus. We'll stay there again when we return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, RELAXING, & DELICIOUS!”
Reviews.Author: fractal22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. We stayed for the Busker festival at St. Lawrence Market, which was only a 3 minute walk. The hotel is in walking distance of a lot of awesome stuffâ€¦15 minute walk to the Harbor front, 5 minute walk to Queen Street, 15 minute walk downtown. There is a gas station and convenience store located right outside the door. Amazing, delicious breakfast with the biggest variety Iâ€™ve ever seen at a hotel; eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, cereal, fruit, cinnamon buns, juice, milkâ€¦you get the idea. The room was amazing too; had a nice bathroom, showerhead, couch, tv, and a beautiful view of the water. I recommend this to any one and am defiantly staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your holiday at this inn!”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyfamily
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several hotels in Toronto, and this turned out to be a good choice. Easy to find and get to. Located in a safe neighborhood, close to the St. Lawrence market. A small courtyard is in front of this hotel, and a convenience store and gas station across the street. St James Park is right next door, and the church bells can be heard ringing on Sunday morning. The park is a very pleasant one to walk by. Parking could be difficult on a busy Saturday night. We arrived after a nightmarish 13 hour drive, to discover that the parking garage was full. The front desk did direct where parking could be found - down the street at a public lot or further down at another hotel. Clearly they did note my distress at the thought of even telling my husband we'd have to drive even further just to park. Luckily, the garage attendant did stop at the desk at that moment and let the staff know that two more spaces had become available. We accepted one with sincere gratitude. Parking was $20 a night, which we have found is on average with other hotels in the city and other major cities. The room was a decent size. It could have used a bit more counter room in the bathroom, but overall adequate. The closet/TV/drawer combination is interesting - the only negative was the closet was dark, and the light above it wasn't quite positioned correctly so you could see inside. Beds were excellent. Carpet in the hallway did have a big stain on it on our floor but otherwise the place was well kept. Laundry can be found right next to the the front desk area. You'll need to get tokens from the front desk as opposed to using your own coins. Its just a single washer/dryer stackable so plan accordingly. Nice counter for folding laundry. Breakfast is one of the biggest conveniences in staying at this hotel. You'll find many hotels don't necessarily have a place to eat and you'll have to find a Second Cup or Tim Hortons's every morning. The breakfast area was apparently not part of the original design. We were glad we looked it over the night before. You'll see the one side with all of the food along one wall that juts in and out, and tables across. Then if you take note - there is another room on the side of the elevators that appears larger - which has a coffee station and tables. This was our preferred location to eat breakfast - less crowded. The food was good, hot and well replenished. The two coffee stations made a big difference getting breakfast out quickly. The hot cinnamon rolls are always the best part. Reasonably close to King or Queen stations on Yonge. We chose this location to be near the Mill Street Brewery and it was an reasonable walk to the Distillery District, with great choices in dining. Overall we'd recomend this hotel as a good place to stay in Toronto and we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “A satisfactory hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: emx88
Reviews.Content: The best feature was the buffet breakfast that was included in the price: the coffee was good, the food selection was extensive and the quality was good. The room was comfortable and clean, with an occasional musty odor that was tolerable. The bathtub had no ledge on the far side and it was difficult to get in and out for a bath. The TV was old and the choice of channels was unsatisfactory. The free daily paper at the room door was nice. There was a convenient computer and printer for the guests in the lobby which unfortunately had "unregistered shareware" that frequently blocked the activities for 30 seconds (the manager claimed that somebody must have downloaded it without their knowledge). For some mysterious reason I could not use my VISA debit card to pay the bill. The hotel was a few blocks from streetcars, buses and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Location, cleanliness, breakfast buffet and service excellent!”
Reviews.Author: justfiddling
Reviews.Content: I am a hard-to-please senior traveler with limited ability to walk distances and I was very happy with the hotel's location two short blocks north of the St. Lawrence Market (excellent inexpensive eat-in or take-out food stalls in historic setting), two blocks to either of two streetcar lines, close to subway system, close to downtown shopping. Best of all, the staff at the hotel are polite, the breakfast buffet is generous with options for every diet, my room was clean. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Lederfrau
Reviews.Content: Sure the rate was decent for a hotel in downtown Toronto. I am a Gold Priority member and I was really hoping for better. I recently stayed in a refreshed Holiday Inn which was not Express and I was quite impressed. This is why I chose to stay here. Lobby looks fine, because of that I was expecting the room to be much better. Once I opened the hotel room door I was immediately disappointed. As for what was refreshed in the room I had to stop and look: the shower curtain and shower head, the mattress, pillows and linens. That was it as far as I could tell. The light switch in the bathroom was filthy and didn't want to touch it. The little love seat was dingy looking. The carpet was most certainly not "refreshed". I check for bed bugs at every hotel and this place was fine. I can tell that the mattress is new and clean. If it was dirty I would have been out of there. I needed to iron my suit for the next day. The ironing board was stained. The iron worked fine and had written in marker "Quality Inn". I just made sure to wash my hands well after putting everything away. It was late, I was tired and I had an early meeting so I just passed out for the night. The bed was comfy. Breakfast the next morning was okay. The breakfast room staff looked pretty busy cleaning up after other people's messy children or I would have asked if there is a way to get a breakfast to go. I just ate quickly and hurried off to my meeting. I'm really not sure that I can recommend this place. If you are only looking for somewhere to rest your head then it's probably okay. If you are expecting a refreshed room, what can I say, maybe my criteria is off but I have seen better at Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed”
Reviews.Author: Sharon_BRA
Reviews.Content: To find a hotel great is always about the reason of your trip, I stayed in the Holiday Inn Toronto Downtown during a vacation trip to Canada and New York City. All I wanted was a clean and comfortable place to stay during the night after exploring the city during the day. I got exactly what I needed and maybe a little more. The staff was incredibly helpful, attentive and polite. The room was comfy, the beds really comfortable and the shower was great. What more did I need? Well, they even offered breakfast, which for me was more than I need to begin my day including eggs, bacon, several kinds of bread, cereals, juice, coffee, milk etc. My stay also included complimentary internet access - wireless, thank God! - I don't know how I would feel about it if I were in a business trip, but for someone who was just checking locations, maps and information about the city's attraction, it was just perfect. The location was another plus. It's close to Saint Lawrence Market and the Eaton Centre (the heart of downtown) but still a very quiet area, something I find very important when I want to sleep. If you like to save money, go ahead and plan your trip using the public transportation in the city. It's very easy to use, clean and more importantly can take you practically to every attraction in the city (if not the subway, then the buses or the combination of both). Queen Station is within walking distance from the hotel and is right under Eaton Centre. If you're looking for good location, nice staff and comfortable stay within a medium to low budget, I definitely recommend this hotel to you.
