Reviews.Title: “good hotel, internet sucks”
Reviews.Author: SquidBox
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here quite a few times now over the last few years. This is a fine hotel, great value for the money at least in downtown toronto. Breakfast is included, and with a couple of hot dishes (eggs or bacon or scones) is an order of magnitude better than any of the free continental breakfasts offered in most north-american hotels. I like the location; it's not the ritziest area of town, but plenty safe and walking distance from the train station. Clean and quiet too. (Free) internet access was another big plus, and used to be adequate----sadly since they changed it all to wireless it is now slow as can be (ie can read email, but web-surfing is desperation only, and VPN is completely impractical).

Reviews.Title: “$140 A Night For This?!”
Reviews.Author: BoxerBlake
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stopped in Toronto for the night before taking the train to Niagara Falls. When we got to the hotel, the first thing we noticed were sketchy people nearby looking for handouts. When we entered the hotel, nobody was at the front desk. I waited for 5 mins before looking around the corner to see two men near the back office watching TV. After getting their attention, we checked in. The room we had was about the size of an office at work. It felt cramped and uncomfortable. On the positive side it did appear clean. When we got up in the morning, my girlfriend was not happy to see that the hair dryer didn't work. We didn't even bother to touch the crummy looking breakfast that was offered. It would be a good deal if this hotel was $50 per night as our room in Niagara Falls was 100x better and only cost $45 more a night with a ton of amenities. I expected far better for a Holiday Inn, and wont be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with the others, this is a good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: koulla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel initially for three days, and then an extra two days because my return flight was cancelled due to the Volcanic Ash incident. It is located very near the center, 20 minutes walk. There is also a convenient pick-up from the hotel to see the Niagra Falls. Breakfast is okay, although it could be a bit better based on what they charge at the hotel. It is not as cheap as other Holiday Inn Express hotels I have stayed, but its location is very convenient. The hotel is clean, and 99% of the staff are very friendly. Be aware of the lady (1%) that passes by the rooms and checks to see if you have checked out. She is quite abrupt! I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Night-time management poor, parking situation far from great.”
Reviews.Author: BritGRRRL
Reviews.Content: Reading past reviews of this hotel make a little more sense now why we had such odd treatment during the night of our stay. There have been problems here with noisy groups? We arrived as a large group - older women so no wild behaviour on our floor like the noisy bachelorette party on the 8th floor. A night-shift employee was constantly parading the hallway and standing outside our rooms until the wee hours. At one point he was very alarmed when 12 of us gathered in one of the suites to watch a powerpoint presentation from one of the member's excursions out west. Like I said, nothing wild. When we arrived, at 6pm we were also told that parking was not available at the hotel and recommended to park down the road at a slightly higher rate of $25 per night. We were warned that the neighbourhood was not the best and to empty our cars completely before locking it up for the night. Fortunately, the cars and few contents remained intact. Obviously in the city you expect to see homeless people (this hotel is across the street from a homeless shelter) and we were only asked for money once during our stay there, far less than during our stay in San Francisco. Didn't see much trouble around the hotel entrance though. Rooms were nice and clean. We had plenty of room. Noise level from the street and nearby church bells was tolerable. Heat level perfect. Price was a bit high to me (around $155 per night) but maybe that's average for Toronto. In one word.... I'd give this hotel a "meh"

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: amandah62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night. We came from Montreal to see a concert at the Air Canada Center. This hotel was affordable and close enough to Yonge street, and close enough to the ACC. (to the air canada center it's about a 7$ cab ride). The hotel staff was very friendly, gave alot of information about the breakfast and made us feel very comfortable. The Rooms were very spacious. We just had a Queen Bed, and in the room was a very large bathroom. (loved the shower by the way!!) There was a cabinet with a TV inside, a lot of channels to choose from. The bed was VERY comfortable. My boyfriend and I said it was one of the best sleeps we've ever had! You can control your own heating inside the room, which helped alot. I found the hallways to be VERY hot. The heat was turned up way too high. But because we can adjust out own temperature in our room, I didn't mind it at all. Also in the room is a couch and a desk. The hotel also equips you with internet. I used my iPod touch and had no problem accessing the internet through it either. The breakfast was amazing. So many foods to choose from. Overall, I really liked this hotel and I will deffinitly stay there again whenever I come back to Toronto. Affordable and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with a great AGM in Toronto"”
Reviews.Author: HEALEY-SPRITE
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 2 nights in this hotel after driving over from Niagara. Our room in Niagara had been pretty small and I wasn't sure what to expect in Toronto. Our room was easily twice the size (and about the same price) as the Niagara room. The front desk staff, especially Mr. Golden, the assistant general manager went out of their way to make our stay in Toronto very special! I strongly recommend this hotel and their excellent staff to anyone considering a visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: jclaire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and it was perfect for us. We had come to do some sightseeing.The staff at reception were courteous and helpful.They booked trips and answered any questions about Toronto. The room was spotless,the beds very comfortable and the heating was just right. The breakfasts were good and set us up for the morning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to come as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: RaeJay
Reviews.Content: I had an early appointment I needed to get to, and I didn't want to have to shell out a huge amount of money for one night in a hotel. This hotel was one of the closest to my appointment and the price was right. I read the reviews on trip advisor before booking and decided that they had more good than bad going for them. We booked the hotel, and when we showed up the only thing they did warn us about was "Someone had their car broken into and all that was stolen was chocolates". Unfortunately this meant we had to unpack our full car just to make sure nothing of importance might get stolen, but they did warn us. Nothing happened to our car, and we parked it beside the booth where they check you in and out of the garage. The room was clean, and the amenities smelled really nice :). We had a lamp in our room that wouldn't turn work so maintenance came up and fixed it for us within 10 minutes of calling. We were also able to order food from Swiss Chalet and have it delivered to our room without a hassle. The breakfast in the morning was good, simple, but when you are in a hurry all the essentials are there. All in all I would say that our stay at this hotel was perfect and we didn't run in to any problems while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Bosh4Fan
Reviews.Content: Spent the night in toronto to see a Raptors game, great location to stay if you're not looking to stay at one of the ritzy hotels right downtown. Shopping mall only 1 km walk and ACC and Rogers center about a 3 km walk, walked everywhere, not that far especially for the price. The rooms were nice, up to date, and the service, I think Steve was the one who checked me in was super nice and when I called down to the front desk at 11pm they were very helpful with directions and recommendations. I will stay in this hotel anytime I need to spend a night in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FlightAtten
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so clean and the room was nice!! Location was perfect!!!!!! +++ The continental breakfast was very good !! Honnestly i have no bad comments on that hotel!! Thats under rated!

Reviews.Title: “Hall parties spoiled an otherwise great stay”
Reviews.Author: bronwyn_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Saturday night. We enjoyed many of the things this hotel has to offer, namely, location, great rate, good breakfast , fast elevators and very comfortable bed. However, a couple of things detracted from this experience greatly. In reserving online we asked for a quiet room away from the elevators. We were given the room next to the elevators. However, it had a great view so we figured as long as it was quiet, it would be fine. About 10 Saturday night a hall party started. These guests had 3 room on our floor. Just when we were going to phone to request a room change, about 11pm, we heard a member of the hotel staff talking to the partiers. . The noise stopped until 3am, when we were woken with lould talking, screaming and much door slamming. This went on until 4:20, when we again heard hotel staff talking to the partiers. The next mornig we met the people in the next room who said they had called the front desk twice because they were also unable to sleep. No one on that floor would have been able to sleep through the noise. Sunday morning I returned to my room at 11:30am after some shopping to find that my key card had become inactive and I was locked out. I went down to the front desk and was told that all cards are made inactive at 11am checkout time. However, we are Priority Club members and our checkout time is much later. They did reactivate my card, but it was just a nuisance to have to have this dome. When we complained about the excessive noise in the hotel on checkout, Steeve just said sorry and that it was not usually noisy. While I was looking forward to making this our new home away from home when visitng Toronto in the future, now I am very hesitant to return. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Kani86
Reviews.Content: it was okie according to the price but was not as good as other holiday inns i have been to in comparison

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: gotta-c-sun
Reviews.Content: We hadn't made any plans before arriving in Toronto, uncharacteristic for me, so on a Saturday night we found ourselves in the position of driving around, asking for rates and availability. The first few hotels we stopped at were closer to the downtown core, but were also way too expensive, when we just wanted a clean bed for 1 night. The Holiday Inn Express was an excellent choice, in the end. It isn't fancy, but the room was clean, the bed was amazingly comfortable and we had pillows labelled "firm" and "soft" to choose from. The staff was very friendly. The location is also good - close enough to downtown and easy to get around. The rate included a full breakfast. I don't usually mind buffet scrambled eggs, but these ones were very powdery - ew. But there was lots of other selection, which was all good. Overall a good choice and I would stay again on a similar trip.

Reviews.Title: “alright hotel...”
Reviews.Author: pandabear88
Reviews.Content: I was told this place was close to the Toronoto Convention Center, it wasn't. It was a 20 minute walk. Basically, I had to take a cab every which way. I don't mind walking, but it was 38 degrees outside. Located in a sketchy area. Salvation Army across the street, which mean tons of homeless people. The only plus side is the free "quick breakfast" in the morning, free WiFi and Starfish around the corner. Starfish is a great seafood restaurant with lots of variety. Also, there's a Starbucks around corner. Didn't figure that out until my last day there. If I can redo this, I rather stay at the InterContinental which connects to the Convention Center undergound.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SarahB112
Reviews.Content: Check-in was smooth. They upgraded our room for free. We got the room for half the price of anywhere else on 1800hotels.com. Amazing deal! The room was huge with high ceilings. The building was beautiful. The free breakfast was delicious and fresh. Great location! Near the subway and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: jlht96
Reviews.Content: Out of all the mid-priced hotels, Holiday Inn Express has been my favorite. My favorite things are the comfortable beds with a clean duvet covers and the continental breakfast. I usually find this chain to be of good value. This specific location was very good--although I would recommend exercising caution if walking in the area at night, because there was what appeared to be a men's shelter not too far away. That being said, my family and I never felt threatened in any way. If you are out late, you can easily take a cab directly to the door of the hotel and never interact with any seedy characters. This location is not too far from the sites. We easily walked to the lake (ferry to Toronto Islands) and the city hall area on two separate mornings without any problem (30-45 minute walk, I think). The breakfast was good and had all of the usual things (scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, bagels, cereal, yogurt, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, coffee, milk, juice, cinnamon rolls). There is an abundance of seating, too (in three rooms) in the breakfast area. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. There is free wi-fi. I gave it three stars for cleanliness because the carpet in our room felt a little grungy, and there was a small stain on one of our bedsheets. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent basic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: valuefiend
Reviews.Content: holiday inn express is a good choice for clean basic accomodation in good locations and this hotel was close to Eaton centre it was near a park frequented by homeless or socially challenged people, but i encountered no problems as they kept to themselves happy with their bottles in brown paper bags. service was excellent and friendly, rooms were a bit basic with only a coffee maker but clean, free hot breakfast was good and included omelettes and bacon, overall i would reccomend this hotel as good value.

Reviews.Title: “Sevice Amazing, Rooms were average.”
Reviews.Author: laloo22
Reviews.Content: The front desk guys were all very helpful and charming. Although the rooms weren't a hundred percent clean, with some stains on the floor, they were quite cozy and inviting. The continental breakfast was an excellent add-on, with everything from cheese omelet, to cereal, coffee and bagels. I can definitely say that I was touring downtown on a full stomach every morning. All in all, Holiday In Express was well worth my money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Eric46
Reviews.Content: I have found the hotel staff very friendly, helpfull and polite. Room was not too big but very clean with a comfortable bed and with free internet and a very nice breakfast. Only the breakfast room is too small for the amount of people it needs to host. The best reason for choosing this hotel is the excellent location close to the Rogers Center, CN Tower & St. Lawrence Market, Young St. and the marina all within a very reasonable walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably rude night manager”
Reviews.Author: chicagomusician
Reviews.Content: After arriving late in the evening with some colleagues, we were trying to figure out where to park our van that was safe, since the hotel lot was full, and we had some musical equipment in it. The manager told us simply to put it in a public lot up the street, not mentioning that the neighborhood is unsafe, and that they have break-ins to vehicles almost NIGHTLY right inside the hotel courtyard. After parking the van, and noticing that the lot he recommended looked unsafe, the employee on duty informed us about how unsafe the neighborhood was. When we pressed the manager further about this, he started shouting that "our van wasn't his responsibility, and do we think he makes his money from the $400 we paid for our two rooms, etc. etc." He then screamed at his employee for telling us the truth, even though he knew we were concerned about our gear. It was totally unnecessary and totally unbelievable. "Abdul" is not someone who should be working in the service industry. We resolved the problem by unloading our gear into the luggage room and parking the empty van in the sketchy lot, which was less than ideal, but the only option. This all could have been done very easily and calmly, but instead the manager decided that screaming at the customers for no apparent reason would be the best way to resolve the problem. Four thumbs down to this place - we will never stay here again and wouldn't recommend to anyone else that they should.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, but a tad bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: thewanderer-nammo
Reviews.Content: hotels in toronto are a bit expensive compared to US so considering that in mind, this Holiday Inn Express property is a decent bet.. at around 115 $ a night.. u might well not say exact value for money but then like i said.. hotels are expensive in toronto so.. anyways lets talk about this property in detail: a) location is like 5 minutes walk from the real downtown.. the King and YOnge Streets are about 5 minute walk from this.. CN tower is around 15 minutes walk.. location can be given 3.5 out of 5 b) rooms are nothing much to write home about but i bargained for a 12th floor room so had a nice view from the window so worked out fine for me.. so now u know what to do when there.. :) c) rooms otherwise are of decent size.. slightely on the smaller side though .. d) complimentary internet and regular continetal bfast.. e) no inhouse restaurant or gym all in all its a fair deal and can be looked upon for short stays in toronto..

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: wallcova
Reviews.Content: This was a good standard hotel for its price with attentive staff, clean rooms and a great location to see the best of Toronto. It was also surrounded by two of the best restaurants for travellers in the area: The Golden Thai which was superb just around the corner and the Spaghetti House where I ahve never seen so much food for such a reasonable amount before

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable stay, within walking distance of CN Tower and Lakeside”
Reviews.Author: chrisuk1000
Reviews.Content: Standard kind of room, bit dated but comfortable and clean and tidy. Same for the bathroom reasonable size, functional and clean. The room lighting was very poor, but there was free internet and the breakfast I quite enjoyed. The service was very good and nothing was a problem. Bit too keen to get you signed up for tours which I felt were expensive anyway, not sure why??? Whilst I'm on read my review about King tours and Niagara Falls, as they have trips running from here. Top tip - unlike the other times when I suggest the shuttle bus to the airport, here I don't, the taxi worked out cheaper anyway so use them instead. Ask for the standard rate fare to the airport (before you get in the car) Don't use the Limo car service! The boat tour around the island (well actually only to one bit of the island) is okay a nice view of Toronto from out there. Another nice view is from the CN Tower, I recommend you do the top floor as well as the first one, but skip the restaurant though. Additionally Toronto has a normal metro train service like London or New York so its really easy to get around. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and very good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru_Arun
Reviews.Content: We rushed to Toronto for a weeks demonstration at a well known bank. We were late to decide where to stay. Our client recommended few hotels and we choose Holiday Inn Express for it's location mainly. The hotel is in downtown, ideal for business travellers. With almost 200 rooms it offeres both smoking and non smoking options. Rooms are cozy and comfortable. The breakfast options are good but I felt a bit monotonous since we got identical menu thru out the week. The major benefit is the location and for business travellers as well as visitors thats an welcome bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good but......”
Reviews.Author: dolfan123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2008 for the Dolphins v Bills game at the Rogers Centre. The location of the hotel was good and within easy reach of everything. No need to get a taxi, bus or subway to anything in the city centre as it was all close by. The breakfast is what you would expect from an HIX although a bit disappointed with the lack of bacon on Monday morning. The room was OK apart from 2 things: 1) The windows did not seem to close totally and thus a cold wind would come through and there was condensation on the inside of the window panes which added to the cold. 2) Where was the shower gel/shampoo? All there was were 2 tiny "complimentary" cakes of soap which when used smelt terrible. I have stayed in HIX's within North America and Europe and this is the only time that there has not been shower gel/shampoo in the room. When asking about this I was told that no HIX's did this. My response was I had stayed in one only 2 weeks ago in the UK and they did. Response was: well they may do in the UK but we don't here. If you want this stuff you have to go and buy it. Despite these are minor gripes I would recommend this place to people to stay due to it's location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: yarn_addict
Reviews.Content: I had a really short stay at this hotel; less than 12 hours. The staff at the desk were helpful and friendly when I checked in and out. I appreciate this since the room wasn't really that expensive for downtown Toronto. The room was decent. The bathroom had a lot of patches in the wall paper and could have been a little cleaner, but still was cleaner than my bathroom at home. The heater in the room was ancient and loudish but kept the room warm. I wouldn't have a problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “not the best HIX”
Reviews.Author: Skillet_87
Reviews.Content: Parking is safe and easy but a bit over priced for the area ($20/night when it seemed $15 was the going rate). Wall mounted air conditioner was a piece of junk - this thing noisily blew both hot and cold air all night. The only consistency was the noise and that is stripped the air of all moisture. My respiratory tract suffered all day and I was very dehydrated. Management pulls the coffee and tea after breakfast. Is this a Holiday Inn Express? Price is okay and location fine. Room quality was good. Clean. And bathrooms were very well lit. I'd rather spend more and get more.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkOlsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Toronto over the Christmas 2008 holiday season and wasn't disappointed. The hotel, just a few blocks from downtown businesses and shopping was a clean, new, safe and welcoming experience. I stayed during the cold snap of December 2008 so having the subway just a few blocks away was very important. Also, within walking distance was the Central Train Station for Amtrak and VIA Rail Canada and the huge Eaton Shopping Center. I stayed in room 601. I was told by a person at the hotels' front desk that rooms x01 and x15 are best (largest) because they are the corner rooms. My room, facing Lake Ontario, was large, quiet with newer (in my opinion) furnishings such as a large flat screen television. There is an Internet-enabled PC in the lobby for which you can purchase a usage card for a rate of $10/hour - not cheap but there are no other choices if you don't bring your own and use the free in-room Wi-Fi. If coming from the YYZ airport (Pearson) and you don't have a lot of luggage and want to save the price of a taxi, take the Rocket bus ($2.75 - exact change or purchase a token when exchanging money at the currency exchange booths in the airport) and then take the bus (10-15 minutes) to the Kipling metro station (no additional fare required) and then take the train downtown transferring to a southbound train and exiting at the King St. station. The hotel is a simple 3 block walk and it only cost $2.75. My only complaint was the area around the hotel. Across the street was a Salvation Army soup kitchen so if you walked in the wrong direction you might be entering a less than desirable part of town. The buffet breakfast, included in the room rate, was unispiring consisting of the standard coffee, danish, scrambled eggs, bacon, yogurt, juice, milk, etc. It wasn't elaborate but was filling and there was a large amount available no matter what time (7 - 10 am) you happened to come down. Parking was available for $25/day. Overall, I was happy with this Toronto hotel choice. The hotel and room were newer, clean, conveniently located and I got a good rate using the BestWestern.com website

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RulesTools
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the same hotel when it was a Comfort Inn. This is much better than it was then. The bedding was very clean and comfortable. The staff was incredibly helpful. Their breakfast is one of the best I've had at a chain hotel. It's also conveniently located in downtown Toronto. Walking to Queen St. West or the Eaton Centre took less than 15 minutes. I had a conference to go to at Queen and York and was easily able to walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: davemac617
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in August. Fantastic location, within easy walking distance of Eaton Centre, for going further afield subway was nice and handy. Rooms were ok, clean and comfortable. Staff nice and friendly. Breakfast was good too with plenty on offer and we always found somewhere to sit even though always busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Set2GoOhio
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for walking all over the city of Toronto. Our group consisted of four women who were on a weekend getaway to see theater and the sites of Toronto. We walked miles during the day and shows at night. Exhausted, we fell in to the most comfortable beds ever for a good night's rest before the next day of adventures. It's only a block from the St. Lawrence Market and a few blocks from the Eaton Center. We covered the Distillery, Harborfront, Theater Districts and much more from this locale. I would recommend this hotel to all those traveling for a long weekend away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.....Nice location....”
Reviews.Author: kobefell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in August.Good basic hotel.Nice location.Breakfest was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Dollar”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveller079
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Toronto, in part because this hotel is so conveniently located. We could walk everywhere (including the subway and train stations) and there are loads of things to do within 20 minutes walking distance. Hotel staff was friendly and efficient. The room itself is basic but clean and more than adequate. Breakfast was a bonus too. Cinnamon rolls, bagels, muffins, breads, fruit, and a couple of hot items plus juice and coffee. The only negative issue we had was the construction ongoing during our stay. It's not really a huge deal but we wish we had been told about it. Our room faced the construction site and every morning between 6:30am and 7:00am, the crane would start up and wake us up. On the good side, getting up early let us start our day early too!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: LucyL1979
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I came for a 2 night stay during Caribana & enjoyed it very much. We arrived several hours before the actual check-in time & was able to get the room without having to wait in the lobby. Our room was comfortable & roomy enough. Although our window view was mostly of the construction area, we did not see it as a priority. They are building bigger & better things in Toronto. So it was understandable. Also, we didn't plan on staying in the room throughout our stay. Thankfully, public transportation are minutes away, which gave our wallet a break from the taxi fares. The free morning breakfast included was abundant with a great variety. That helped prevent us from unneccasarily buying breakfast. Also, in the lobby area, there's a convenient 24-hour coffee/tea stand. All in all, we were given courteous service from the staff. The nearby park, St. James church & nearby eateries were also great places to visit during our stay. We definitely will return here. Thank you Holiday Inn Express in downtown Toronto :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: kpapadop007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid July 2008 as a Priority Club award stay. It was an incredible value as they ran a promotion for ony 5,000 PC points per night. The location is great, you can walk anywhere. Parking at $20 per day hurts a little but it is standard in downtown. I stayed on the 15th floor and the room was fine. The decor and carpet definitely showing some wear and tear. The breakfast was very busy and quite good. Great to have coffee free all day in the lobby. Some issues with my reservation were resolved in a very nice matter by courteous front desk people. No issues with my stay at all. Very pleased with the value I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good package”
Reviews.Author: Juusto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two years ago during our first trip to Canada. We toured around Ontario and every time we got back to Toronto, we went back to HIE, since we had liked it so much in the beginning of the holiday. So now in July on our second trip to Canada, HIE was the obvious choise during our four nights in Toronto. The value is very good, especially having the breakfast included in the room price. Now with the hot food added to the breakfast buffet, there is a lot to choose from. In many other hotels the room prices are more expensive and yet one has to pay extra for breakfast that could be 10-15 CAD pp. The location is excellent too. St. Lawrence market and the lovely Front Street, and Eaton Centre are very close. Also within walking distance are Harbour front, Distillery District, Hockey Hall of Fame, Air Canada Centre, CN Tower and Roger's Centre. We found it safe to walk even after 10 PM from Roger's Centre (after watching a Blue Jays game) back to the hotel. St. James Park across Adelaide Street is nice with lots of people walking their dogs. Also I thought that the current building of new Condos across Jarvis will make the area even nicer on that side once finished. The staff is always polite and friendly and ready to help you. We checked in earlier than the normal time, no problem. On the departure day we asked, if we could check out late, since our flight wasn't until late afternoon. This was no problem and there was no extra charge. All in all, a very nice experience again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Truckerbob
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the hotel. This was my first time at this location. It was clean, the employees nice and breakfast was better then I expected. I found the bed kind of on the hard side but still I had a good sleep. If you take the airporter bus from the toronto international airport to the Sheridan Center it is about a 10 - 15 min walk to this hotel. About 7 dollars to taxi down to Front Street for the Air Canada Centre or Rodger's skydome, CN tower. Received my wake call on time and check out was a breeze. The breakfast had eggs and bacon along with the fruit, toast, bagels, etc. I will stay here the next time I am in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Visitingtoronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 4 nights. Found the staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean, well maintained, and I had the best sleep I've had in a long time with the comfortable bed and pillows. The breakfast bar was basic breakfast fare with hot and cold items and there was lots of it. Also staff were deligent in restocking items and were friendly. The location was great being a short walk from most attractions. I like to walk so I appreciated the exercise. Even if I had to get a taxi to the Metro Convention Centre it only cost $6 or $7 for the fare one way. For the money we paid it was good value. It wasn't the Sheraton but it also didn't have the Sheraton room rate either. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DocGeni
Reviews.Content: This is pretty much your run of the mill Holiday Inn Express. The rooms are clean and a bit larger then most of the other HIE's I have stayed in, and it is not long on hte amenities. However, the location is quite convenient. There are lots of good restaurants and shops within walking distance, and downtown Toronto, the Rogers Centre and the Arena are a short hop away (a walk in some cases). The staff is courteous and helpful. My only complaint was hte lack of a refrigerator in the room and the high price of parking CAD17.00 per day. Otherwise, this is a good choice for a place to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: jsbVancouver
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels all over the world for over 60 years and this was the very first one which neglected to give us our requested 'wake up' call. As we were to take VIA rail that morning, we fortunately woke up on our own. When I asked what happened to our wake up call, I just received a disinterested and not even remotely apologetic "we put it in the computer". We had also booked months before our trip and requested a room no higher than the 5th floor. This was totally disregarded. The room was drab, sparse and not particularly clean. In all honesty, I would never recommend this poor excuse of a hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value--Excellent Location--Hotel Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: boowaaccaa
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great--very close to the downtown. The parking is reasonable for underground parking in the area. The halls decor was pretty dated and the room's furniture was cheap quality. The bed was comfy for watching TV but oddly very uncomfortable for sleeping. The shower was amazing--curved rod for extra room and an adjustable, excellent pressure shower head. Breakfast was decent--bagels, cerel, muffins, coffee and juice--enough to eat--but nothing too exicting (but it was included in the price so for that it was good.) Overall for the price and location---this hotel gets top rates--(everything else in the area that is not a dive, hostel, or has a strip club on the main level is about $50 extra for the night--)

Reviews.Title: “Luckily they found me another room!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanQueen22
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 3 months in advance due to the fact that the weekend we stayed was Caribana and this tends to be very very busy. I booked 3 rooms and asked for them all to be near eachother since there was a group of 12 of us going down. I called and cancelled the 3rd room because it was no longer needed. I asked to get the price for the other 2 rooms and all of a sudden the price was about $30 more per room then I was quoted when I originally booked. Okay, no big deal, I guess the first girl forgot to tell me that parking was $25 and every extra person was $10... No biggy, at least I still had 2 rooms booked. So when we arrived at the hotel I went to check in the 2 rooms (this was at about 7pm) and I was told that I only had one reserved. I was furious. I was told that when I called and cancelled the one room that I actually cancelled 2 rooms. I was also told that it MUST have been a mistake on my end. I let them know that I had all my confirmation numbers and everything. They found me another room (as if they were doing me some kind of favour). The rooms were only 6 floors away from eachother, but again no biggy right? We were also informed that upon checking in that there was no parking left and they we would have to park down the street. I was told that check-in was at 3pm and that is why there was not parking... OKAY. We parked down the street, it turned out to be cheaper then parking at the hotel anyways. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They were both very small but for the price one can't complain. The proximity to the club district was perfect. You are close to shopping and everything, which is great for cabbing and walking. Over all, I would book here again for the simple fact that it is cheap and close to everything. My only advice would be to make sure you print out all you confirmation numbers and take them with you. (especailly on busy weekends like Caribana, I was lucky they found me a room at all, or actually they were lucky!! lol) Dont bother parking at the hotel, you can save $10 if you walk a block.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: seashellseeker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, as our previous hotel (Novotel) was booked up for the Gay Pride event. We loved the area surrounding Novotel and were happy to stay in the vicinity for the rest of our stay. However, as two female travellers, we felt more and more uneasy as we approached this hotel. Best not to go via Jarvis and the rear of the hotel, as we did - it gives a bad impression, due to the Salvation Army hostel nearby. This made us uneasy throughout our stay, although the front entrance to the hotel was much nicer. Rooms ok and clean, but decor dark and depressing. It definitely has a 'run down' feel about it in places. On the plus side, the staff were great and breakfast was good - loads to choose from. We were a little surprised to find no safe anywhere in the hotel, though. Not recommended for solo female travellers, but guys would be ok there. Convenient for most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: patncolin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in May 07 The Hotel was well located for Yonge street and other attractions but seemed to be a deprived part of town. Though we never felt threatened . The CN Tower is within walking distance as is the harbour front though they are about 20- 30 minutes away. The room was comfortable and clean and had all mod cons you expect. Parking was not included in the price and was abit pricey. Breakfast was plentiful and of good quality

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: blackbourn210181
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and found it very clean and comfortable, with a good sized room and really nice continental breakfast. Staff were pleasant and helpful - I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a reasonably priced break, as it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: mkkk
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a great stay. Parking cost us $15 for a 24 hour period with in/out privileges. We were a little worried about the location but it was OK...far enough from Yonge so the noise level wasn't bad. Breakfast was OK...not too many choices...mainly muffins, cereal, toast or bagels. Room was very good, nothing to complain about. Would recommend to those who want a decent place to stay without paying a lot of money. We love Cambridge Suites but for the price difference, we'll probably be staying here more often!

Reviews.Title: “good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadabound
Reviews.Content: whilst walking away from the hotel to head into central Toronto, a female passing motorist called out to us to "watch your money,it's not that great an area" This caused us to become a bit paranoid and we would have looked around for another hotel but as the AIDS conference was in full flight everywhere was booked up.however having had to give the hotel a chance there really isn't a problem as long as you take sensible precautions you would in any city,avoid park areas at night and take a cab if you're really concerned.Best way to walk to city centre is to walk along Adelaide st to Yonge st-that way you're walking past offices and decent looking restaurants The rooms are comfortable and clean,breakfast a bit indifferent but it's free!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably located and priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: planethopper
Reviews.Content: Located fairly close to the central area, about 5mins walk from King or Queen Subway. Rooms were clean and pleasant but decor in the hotel could do with a spruce up in places compared to other Holiday Inn Express hotels I have stayed in. Breakfast was of a good standard and the free internet access in room was good. Staff were helpful and friendly. Overall reasonably good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: dandeeranch
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here mid-October, 2005 and had a pretty good experience. Staff was helpful and friendly; breakfast cafe seemed to have quite a bit to offer--we got full anyway. Reasonably priced, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, very close to downtown, 10 minute walk to the Eaton Centre, financial area and Union Station. Lots of great restaurants around, including Starfish just down Adelaide from the hotel. Staff were friendly, service was good and breakfast was included. HI-Express is the way to go when in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a completely different experience from the previous poster. We booked two rooms each with one Queen and small sofa. Our rooms were very large. We had plenty of room. For the price ($117 Canadian per night + taxes) this was a great find. I did notice some floors were being renovated so perhaps that is why the previous poster had a bad room. The continental breakfast was very good considering it was included in the room price. It was very busy both Saturday and Sunday morning. Choices included cinanmon buns, boiled eggs, white and brown toast, muffins, bagels, cereal, bananas, apples and oranges, coffee, milk (skim and 2%) and orange and apple juice. We ate breakfast there both mornings. We found the neighbourhood very safe. There is a salvation army one block over as well as a youth hostel but we did not see any vagrants loitering and we walked to and from the Keg Restaurant on Friday night (returned about 10:30pm) and felt very safe. There is a 24 hour Dominion store (grocery store) about a 3 minute walk from the hotel as well as a Second Cup and other small restaurants. The Laurence market and farmer's market is about a 7 minute walk from the hotel. You could walk to the Eaton's centre or the CN Tower but it might be a bit of a hike. We cabbed to and from the CN tower and it cost $8.00 each way. We parked in the garage ($11 Canadian per day) and it didn't seem dirty but I wasn't really looking. The hotel staff were helpful although I would not buy anything in the little convenience store in the lobby - too expensive. Walk down the street to the grocery store. One thing - if you are a light sleeper the bells in the church nearby start ringing around 6:30am and that can be a bit annoying. Overall we were very happy with this hotel. I think you will find it difficult to find anything else in the same price range, same fairly central location, and same level of cleanliness. It is certainly not the Sheraton but unless you gamble with hotwire you probably won't get the Sheraton for $117 per night. In any case we would stay here again and we would recommend it for budget minded travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, Outskirts of Downtown area, Better Values elswhere”
Reviews.Author: johninajijic
Reviews.Content: We stayed nere from Sept. 15 thru Sept 21, 2005. The Pros: Desk help was friendly, rooms were clean, continental breakfast looked OK, we didn't partake of that. The Cons: Hotel is outdated and older. Rooms were much too small with 2 double beds. No room for luggage. Hallway carrpets black with dirt, I assume from garage. The garage was absolutely filthy, so it tracked into the building. This hotel is on the outskirts of downtown, near Front street, about a half mile from true downtown. There are homeless shelters very close by, like Salvation Army outreach, certainly not a nice part of Toronto. Toronto is a gorgeous city. Save your money and go elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Toronto Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 111 Lombard Street, Toronto, Ontario M5C 2T9, Canada
